website_summaries.verdict: The Lytro Illum lures buyers with the promise of refocusable images, but its image quality is disappointing and its price sky high.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. But I warn you it is NOT a replacement for a DSLR it is a specialty camera that is designed for a particular concept.
customer_reviews.author: Porter Brown Jr

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not for the average user
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known their return policy. The item arrived late and was no use for the event I wanted to use it for. After that I realized that it needs a flash that is almost expensive as the camera itself. The pictures are great if you have time to work with the software and huge memory capacity but for the regular family photos this is not a worthy camera. More importantly the customer service is nil. It has been two weeks and I still don't have a response for the return request.
customer_reviews.author: fghr

customer_reviews.title: With a stationary subject grouping, and on a tripod, it can give a very interesting result, ok if you get it for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for 350.00 clearance price, but you would be in tears if you paid 1600.00 list price. The camera is heavier than a DLSR and cumbersome to use in real life settings. With a stationary subject grouping, and on a tripod, it can give a very interesting result, The IQ is good enough for an 8x 10 print if you dont; crop the subject. Its value as a camera is to force you to think differently about subject placement and depth of field. I though it was a good photography technique to learn. The lens is a very fast constant apeture f 2 lens that is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Monahan

customer_reviews.title: The features it had were cool, but I found them somewhat impractical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and ended up returning it. The features it had were cool, but I found them somewhat impractical. The resolution wasn't great, and for what it did do well, I wasn't hugely impressed. Depth of focus pictures are neat, but it's a pickle putting them up anywhere for people to see them. Just save up for a decent dslr camera.. Sory Lytro. Keep innovating, get the megapixels up and maybe in a few years, this will really take off.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra J. Croft

customer_reviews.title: This camera could get 5 stars if they updated their desktop software
customer_reviews.text: This camera could get 5 stars if they updated their desktop software and it could get three stars for not updating their desktop software. With that said it is a very cool high tech camera and the price drop from 1400 to 300s due to the complicated desktop software makes it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Akira

customer_reviews.title: Using the lytro software to play with the photos is great. I subtract one star because it is huge ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting and fantastically advanced toy but not really practical. It is heavy and the photos print poorly. Then again, printing the photos is not the point. Using the lytro software to play with the photos is great. I subtract one star because it is huge and heavy... A valid complaint but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Resolution is quite limited
customer_reviews.text: Cool camera and technology, but the resolution is quite limited.
customer_reviews.author: BAMAJR

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised, pretty brick.
customer_reviews.text: So I took a long walk through the city with this awesome looking camera. Loads of ooohs and aaaahs...people wanting pictures taken and wanting to share them via social media and....what a waste of money this pretty paperweight turned out to be. Nothing in the advertising tells you of the camera's main limitation, which makes it entirely not fit for purpose. You know, like you can't actually use the pictures. So all positive advertising is essentially false, a lie by ommision. Correct me if I’m wrong, but a camera that cannot produce a useable image isn’t a camera, it’s a designer brick. In summary, this camera is a beautifully packaged, futuristically designed, expensive failure.
customer_reviews.author: Adams & Company

customer_reviews.title: But takes pictures that have wonderful color saturation
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting used to. But takes pictures that have wonderful color saturation. And the ability to change the depth of field after the picture has been taken allows for curing a multitude of ills.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Hunt, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worried at first but now like it very much.
customer_reviews.text: Paid $399 for the camera and experiment with it almost every day. It makes me think differently about photography when I use my other gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not for use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a concept camera . The Wifi is absolutely useless and takes 5 minutes before it can transfer one picture. Quality of pictures are bad and blurry. I guess that putting it on Tripod will improve the pictures. I have had several Nikons and Leica cameras. This one is going in my closet for a big mistake and will never be used again. Don't make the same mistake. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Amirkhas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: WORKED GREAT BUT COULD NOT FIND PLATFORM TO MANIPULATE PHOTOS SO I COULD PRINT. I'LL WAIT FOR NEXT GEN
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Nice experience but wouldn't replace a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: 1. A nice tool to explore, if you can afford it, go ahead and buy it but if you want to replace it with a DSLR, I wouldn't recommend that.It will never do that. 2. Outdoor performance is average but indoor/low light performance is horrible, you'll need to buy a flash too. My YN 565 EX II Speedlight works fine with it. 3. However I paid extra shipping cost to get it on time, even so, there was a day delay in arriving. Almost missed the flight.
customer_reviews.author: Mamun S.

customer_reviews.title: need to relearn what I know about photography.
customer_reviews.text: I love cameras and bought this one on impulse, haven't given it the time it deserves to learn it. Shoot first focus later...
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea but not very useful for me
customer_reviews.text: Mostly a gimmick, the actual pixel count isn't very good. It's fun to play with the depth of focus and even wiggle things a little, but the utility of producing still photos isn't great for my purposes (especially since the software didn't seem very intuitive although I admit I didn't play with it long since the system requirements precluded using it on my regular machine). If you're making motion pictures, it might be somewhat useful... It's a bit disappointing, since it's a cool idea.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as expected. I did like the way it's displayed though,
customer_reviews.author: George G.

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this camera
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this camera needed some more improvements before they took it to the public. Yes, it is a lot cheaper now than when it first came out, but it's not easy to use. There really is quite a learning curve and the software is pretty slow. Even for a well seasoned photographer, this camera is not easy to use. The pictures it takes are really neat, but I just don't think the technology has developed enough. Verdict: Pass on this camera. It's a great thought, however it just isn't executed very well.
customer_reviews.author: robertchavers

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money.....Its ok but the price suggest it should be much better. I think the idea is on the right track but a fun little camera to play with. I like the ability to edit right on the camera. Sometimes the display looks weird with pixels or white out. hard to tell if it is a good shot or not when this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Boots918

customer_reviews.title: Technologically advanced
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't already researched this piece of tech, I urge you to do so. This isn't a typical camera. The pictures it takes are formatted and require some skill and software to make into your regular jpg format. I really love this device and look forward to the successor of this current gen light ray camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sale

customer_reviews.title: The unboxing was fantastic. Great packaging and presentation
customer_reviews.text: Know what you are buying. I read the reviews and watched all the YouTube videos. I still purchased it played with it for a day and then returned it. The unboxing was fantastic. Great packaging and presentation. The camera itself is awesome looking. Software sucks. Slow to take pics. It's like taking stills with a video camera. It's a concept. Not a product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Dees

customer_reviews.title: poor auto-exposure compensation
customer_reviews.text: For the right setting, this is a neat camera to play with and could provide a lot of flexibility to play with depth of field. Excessive low light noise, excessive compression (or vector calculation) artifacts, slow focus, slow shutter, poor auto-exposure compensation, and slow post-processing makes this innovative camera not worth the money (for my needs).
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for what it proposes to do
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for what it proposes to do. I wish it were easier to work blur , but a lot depends on distances between objects and other factors that are not very clear , sometimes the effect does not happen , even though all right. Forget using ISO above 200, a waste. Not to print photos in larger sizes , it is for use in digital media.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto M. R. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: don't bother. And company went out of business
customer_reviews.text: not worth it, especially mine came with a small scratch on lens, great innovation but not practical, and you cant take good pictures unless you are steady or use a tripod. Update. The company fold. So there is no way you can share picture with public using their server.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wu

customer_reviews.title: What I like about the camera is it's macro capabilities and field ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice at taking photo's. I was looking for a macro lens and this camera itself was cheaper than some of the lens out there. What I like about the camera is it's macro capabilities and field of depth photo's. I'm still learning how to use it but so far I've taken some nice clear pics.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Jonsson

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: I would of gave 5 stars but it would freeze and crash and take forever to load. It's quite frustrating. I would've gave it 3 stars in fact, but the bult-in wifi feature and good quality picture made me put 4 stars. It's a good camera , but there are some things that need to be fixed
customer_reviews.author: Maximus/Steph

customer_reviews.title: Not what i was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this camera. I had been following these guys since Kickstarter days. However, the image quality (4MP for 2D photos) just isn't good enough to do much with. Plus you can't change out the lenses and it is quite bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Silver

customer_reviews.title: Glad lytro reduced the price to a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is decent for ISO ~200, above 400 is even worse than iphone camera. Lens got good macro and overall industrial design is really good. One thing that really annoying, I don't see ND8 filter is anywhere necessary. Bottom lines is, for price with 370 bucks, it's a camera worthy to go for. It gives you decent picture at high light and stunning refocusing ability. (To be honest, previous price is ridiculous: 1200 bucks)
customer_reviews.author: DXM

customer_reviews.title: I love what you can do with the photos and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to try this camera but it was to pricey. When the price dropped so dramatically, I couldn't resist. I love what you can do with the photos and I like pushing the envelope regarding composition. You really need to think how you shoot. Lytro seems to be heading into another direction with their movie camera. Hopefully they won't discontinue platform for the illum. Lots of fun though..
customer_reviews.author: maria r manolaros

customer_reviews.title: Amazing technology
customer_reviews.text: I was vaguely familiar with the technology behind this camera and was interested to see if it was actually more flexible than my standard 35 mm cameras. I have only been using it a few days but have been amazed at how easy it is to use. I viewed several of the training videos on the Lytro Web site and found them very helpful. This is not a camera for casual use because it is too heavy and requires a little time to get the best shot. But if you want the best shot and one that you can alter later, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: JR Hughes-Darsee MD

customer_reviews.title: Misses the mark. It's a cute toy with a (one) neat trick.
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, but a one trick pony that doesn't meet quality standards for great still photos; So, it does one neat thing, but the basics aren't up to par. Not sharp enough, not easy enough, not fast enough. I can't see this being useful day to day. If I take photos for trade shows, or journalism, with this with me, I'd still have to bring an SLR with me. No point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My second Illum camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. I bought an Illum earlier and liked it so much I decided to buy this one as q backup and second camera. I have not used this camera yet to test it but everything is there and all the pieces are in the retail box so everything should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Only good for experimentation
customer_reviews.text: This camera is interesting but def not for everyone. Only good for experimentation. I return it less than two weeks of usage.
customer_reviews.author: RonoTron

customer_reviews.title: LYTRO ILLIUM CRASH, reproducible, poor product, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! The LYTRO ILLIUM crashes when used in conjunction with the LYTRO Flash J680 The main feature of the Lytro illium is the Lytro button which is used in setting up dimensional shots. The biggest problem with these cameras other than low resolution is the graininess of indoor shots. So one would buy the Lytro j680 flash to compensate right? WRONG, the combination of the Lytro botton, the Lytro flash WILL ALWAYS crash the camera. I communicated with tech support their official answer: there are no plans for any new firmware to fix the problem, don't use the Lytro flash with the Lytro button. again BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: also the product is amazing, I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: The seller is so reliable and always reply my emails very quick, also the product is amazing, I like it a lot. The price is fair also.
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, if it’s your “thing”
customer_reviews.text: The concept is amazing and I was immediately drawn to it and bought it. The unfortunate let down is that the sharpness of the photograph is sacrificed. The lack of an onboard flash is also a bit of a let down, especially since it does so poorly in low light. I think that it’s a very interesting experience but was not worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: BenyPoy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to use but amazing if you know how to use this
customer_reviews.author: pinkdebu

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the videos led me to believe.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my daughter, it does not stand out as a great camera, the images are not different enough to see as a special value. We will probably return the camera unless she can find some value in it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A.

customer_reviews.title: Images are not sharp and the post processing app keeps ...
customer_reviews.text: Images are not sharp and the post processing app keeps crashing all the time. Even the camera's software crashed couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Ananth

customer_reviews.title: Superberb
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stuff, my hubby liked it a lot. Recently, used it for the first time during my trip to Tibet and the pictures taken (or processed using Lytro Desktop afterwards) are terrific. Very much suit for somebody has no photography background at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this camera. My main issue with it is that it's as large as my dslr and can not replace my dslr. It's just to large to justify adding to my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: i like it
customer_reviews.text: This little toy is cool, it bring us a new way to shot, you dont need to focus first, the focus could be adjusted after even 3 month. But I have to say, it is new design, it is not as good as DSLR, but i believes that it may change the way we make photo in the future
customer_reviews.author: sijie0626

customer_reviews.title: This phenomenal camera is the "bomb!"
customer_reviews.text: There is no question that this camera is not for everyone. But I have used and still have all the icon cameras going back to the '50s. I currently use an EOS full frame sensor with L lenses for most of my photos. But, for me, this is the bomb! I'm over the pixel and resolution contest. This camera makes you think of perspective and how the human eye works. The simplest shots are interesting. I find you are drawn into the photo. Now I can't wait to go to the places I want to bring back live!
customer_reviews.author: Morton Satin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible - requires special software - total PIA - - better to stay with known camera manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for outside shooting. Got it at $399(without 25Tax)Really a good deal:)
customer_reviews.author: Great Graphic Designer

customer_reviews.title: The sky is the limit with this one, it's ...
customer_reviews.text: The sky is the limit with this one, it's just a little difficult getting the handle on all it can do at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Adamdeus

customer_reviews.title: To take my decision about this camera, I've read ...
customer_reviews.text: To take my decision about this camera, I've read several reviews. Finnaly I can say that it is gorgeous. Many thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 0 update and the camera's other functions work fine but my zoom is fixed at 30mm
customer_reviews.text: The camera's zoom and focus rings doing seem to work. I am unable to see any difference in the picture on the display when I use the zoom ring. In manual focus mode , using the focus ring does nothing to the picture in the display. I think my Illum is broken. I habe the 2.0 update and the camera's other functions work fine but my zoom is fixed at 30mm. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Holzl

customer_reviews.title: DAMAGED PRODUCT !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Camera doesn't show the scene on the display, the screen is totally BLACK!! when I try some general option like timer shooting it restarts automatically, I formatted the SD card and I have read all instruction but nothing mentioning my issue. So the product is totally damaged. The problem that I left to France directly after I got the camera. Since it has no SD card provided, I couldn't try it before I get one. Now I am stuck because I am not coming to US soon, and I feel so bad that I wasted my money and I do not know what to do. CAN ANYONE HELP ME WHAT TO DO?
customer_reviews.author: ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: I was very pumped up about the black Friday deal I got, but when I received the package, I noticed the pins that connects the strap to the body are missing. Communicated this issue multiple times, but didn't receive any response so far. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hossein

customer_reviews.title: Bad picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Bad picture quality. Also cost return. The technology is not there yet. Never buy this again. Canon or Nikon is the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Thien

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my sister and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Fbaishere

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wastage of money. Promising technology but yet to be improved a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Palash K.

customer_reviews.title: I Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera only problems i had were with the software
customer_reviews.author: Ray-Shaun Seon

product_meta.title: LYTRO ILLUM 40 Megaray Light Field Camera with Constant F/2.0, 8X Optical Zoom, and 4" Touchscreen LCD (Black)
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingIntroducing Lytro Illum, the first high-end camera that harnesses the power of light field – capturing the direction, color and brightness of the rays of light within the frame. That means the ability to explore your pictures from different perspectives, focal points and dimensions. A new era of photography has arrived. Now, with Lytro Illum, nothing stands in your way from telling a deeper story by truly capturing life in a different light.
feature_bullets: Sensor: Capture a deeper picture. LYTRO ILLUM's 40 Mega ray customized sensor, with Lytro's patented micro lens array technology, unlocks the ability to capture the color, intensity and direction of the light rays flowing into the camera.

Lens: All you need in just one lens. The incredibly versatile 8x optical zoom, 30-250mm equivalent focal length (35 mm equivalent) with a constant f/2 aperture and 1:3 macro lets you take a wide range of shots without ever having to change your lens.

Lytro Button: Compose your pictures in a new way. During image capture, an interactive depth feedback display shows the relative focus of all objects in the frame, allowing composition in three dimensions.
Light Field Engine 2.0: Bigger pictures, faster processing. LYTRO ILLUM's powerful in-camera software provides real-time feedback allowing for dramatic composition of every shot.

Total Control: Perfect balance of tactile controls and touch interface. With a sleek design, LYTRO ILLUM pairs the controls of a high-end camera with a state-of-the-art 4" touchscreen for ultimate flexibility and control.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars132 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
